Oh, the humanity!!!

.@DrJasonJohnson on calling the police on black people for noncrimes: "The intent of these actions is to remind black people that the ultimate consequence of discomforting white people‚Äîlet alone angering them‚Äîcould be death." More on #AMJoy https://t.co/atOHbSmRwg via @TheRoot

If you see a gang of young black ppl together today, with their grandmothers, staying at an air bnb, playing Young Dolph, eating at Waffle House, grabbing coffee at Starbucks, taking a nap, or organizing a BBQ in the local park, DO NOT CALL THE POLICE, they are graduates!!

The two men arrested at Starbucks took they Black asses on live television and said ‚Äúthis isn‚Äôt a Black people thing, it‚Äôs a people thing.‚Äù 

Let that sink in the next time you think cishet men will be the arbiter for any kind of justice in this country.

Good morning!

Black teen in Michigan shot at when he knocks on a door to ask for directions. Black men in Philly arrested at Starbucks for minding their own business. Don't knock on a door, go to Starbucks, drive, walk, eat. Just die. That is what they want.

Men of color at Starbucks- White woman calls police

Oh, the humanity!!!

Right - just for sitting in Starbucks while Black. Or asking for a spoon while Black. Or going through a TSA line while Black. Or while waiting for a ride to a basketball game while Black. Or filming the police while Black. Or drinking an Arizona Iced Tea while Black. Or... https://t.co/rS9p7GFjTP

Remember when a police officer wasn't allowed to use the restroom at Starbucks because they weren't a paying customer?

I don't recall Starbucks closing 8000 of their stores to train their employees how to respect police officers.

Unlike Starbucks, Waffle House and its employees are embracing racism and police brutality. They hide behind the veneer of praising James Shaw Jr. as a ‚ÄúWaffle House‚Äù hero while maliciously calling the police on black patrons to brutalize them. Outrageous. https://t.co/30d7vQGAAr

https://t.co/Z6qOae0zIa

Funny, how all white people are racist when two black men are arrested in Starbucks, but when a black man wearing a MAGA hat is harassed & threatened in a Cheesecake Factory, the media is just like, "BUT IVANKA IS A GHOUL."

People will call the cops on you if you wait in a Starbucks, if you ask for silverware in a Waffle House, or if you play golf at a golf course ‚Äî but only if you‚Äôre black.

@MsPackyetti wants you to share a moment when you experienced harm simply for being black. Use #whileblack. https://t.co/YOraNNmMWY

So Waffle House is standing by their racist waitress calling police on a Black women because she questioned an attempt to charge for plastic utensils, despite police violently assaulting that woman, so everyone ready to boycott Starbucks two weeks ago, where you at?

What is most startling may be that these white folks calling cops on black people on the golf course, at a Waffle House, or at a Starbucks know that doing so could kill them. There‚Äôs too much awareness of police brutality to not know. They just don‚Äôt care. https://t.co/IYDbVGGrkD

Before Starbucks, Tyler Lumar a loving father, son, brother, was racially profiled & police were called. A broken system that targets Black men failed Tyler & ultimately led to his death. Tyler is an OPRF ALUM May 6th we are holding a rally calling for justice! @ShaunKing https://t.co/726pfpusOB

I just went to @Starbucks this evening to go study for finals. As always, I ordered my drink and put my book bag down in a chair. After ordering my drink and waiting for my name to be called, I gave a quick glance to the chair I set my book bag in and saw it was gone.

.@Starbucks

text:
Years ago, I performed at @ColoradoStateU doing my "Ending Racism in About an Hour" show. Apparently they need a refresher.

One more time...

Racism is not a Starbucks problem. Or a Colorado State University problem. It's an America Problem.

https://t.co/DsOCUf9hzw

Waiting at Starbucks. Barbecuing. Checking out of an Airbnb. Black people in America have had to justify our existence in spaces we‚Äôve had every right to be in simply because others rejected us. This, unfortunately, isn't new. #WhileBlack. https://t.co/Y1Bju3RsVW
Still to this day, my friend‚Äôs mom calls Starbucks ‚ÄúBlockbuster‚Äôs.‚Äù #MomQuotes

Two black men arrested in a Starbucks for not buying coffee. Cops called on a group of black women for golfing too slowly. Stories like this happen every day. What‚Äôs your story? Send us a selfie video describing what happened to you at 2018stories@gmail.com #everydayracism

"Police are able to conduct arrests of the most violent, awful white men without choking or humiliating them, but somehow appear to struggle to provide this same level of human decency to black men, women, and children who are unarmed and nonviolent." https://t.co/dRw7IPw1vb
Father of woman arrested at Waffle House in Alabama says his daughter is "owed an apology, just like the two men in the Starbucks." https://t.co/pxjlFGo5LC https://t.co/Im47gePUs7

2 black guys loitering at Starbucks got more attention than the 2 cops that got ambushed in Florida for doing NOTHING.

Sad times we are living in. The Media is a disservice to the American people

.@Starbucks I SPEND SO MUCH MONEY WITH YOU DAILY - BOYCOTT - NOT ONE DIME UNTIL YOU APOLOGIZE TO THESE MEN PUBLICLY - REIMBURSE THEM FOR THEIR TIME & HUMILIATION - I AM BEYOND DISGUSTED #BOYCOTTSTARBUCKS https://t.co/TmhpDOFh1f

So it turns out not only did the Waffle House shooter have a history of past incidents, but just last week he was reportedly racially abusing people in a grocery store. Yet it was not reported. Meanwhile black men are being arrested for sitting at Starbucks. Ridiculous.

The two black men said they remain upset with #Starbucks because "rules are rules, but right is right." So...it's...morally...wrong...to...require...a...buy...before...permitting...a...customer...to...use...their...restroom?!?
Somebody call the ACLU!!!
